entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cold Temperatures Tonight... Low temperatures in the upper 30s and lower 40s are expected across the Fairbanks area tonight, but widespread frost is not expected. Clear skies this evening will allow temperatures to drop quickly after sunset, but clouds are expected to spread in from the west after midnight and keep temperatures from falling to

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:03PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range into Next Week... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue into next week. entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 1:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WATER EXPECTED TO CONTINUE IN THE SUSITNA BASIN... High water levels can be expected to continue on the Susitna River and its tributaries through the next several days.
